arch:property.oc:show_val: Phase IV: Nabataean Grand Design: 1st c. BCE to CE 1st c. The remainder of the subterranean canalization is installed including the East Plaza Great Cistern. The East and South Perimeter Walls are installed and Rooms A and B and the Tabun Cave Room are built into the casemate of the East Perimeter Wall. The East Plaza and South Passageway are paved and the temple Forecourt is raised and laid with a small hexagonal pavement. Residential Quarter is built in the southwest corner of the precinct. Also at this time the Central Staircase of Phase II is blocked and the lateral East and West Staircases are constructed to access the Lower Temenos.
Lip on the south face of Locus 25

Locus 82 is the lip on the south face of Locus 25. This ledge appears to be part of Locus 25, but was differentiated in the field as a separate locus due to slight differences in the appearance of the south face of the wall. It is a 0.21 m ledge that begins seven courses down from the extant top of the wall. This part of the wall was exposed in the sondage to the south of Locus 25. Unlike the proper part of Locus 25, the courses of Locus 82 are much more roughly laid in mortar, with snecking stones and more unfinished hewn ashlars, less regularly cut than those of Locus 25. Besides the first course of Locus 82, the ashlars are not neatly laid into courses, though it can be said that there are roughly five courses to the locus. This change in the quality of construction could imply that this lip is the beginning of the support wall, as there is no more intact plaster on the surface and fewer of the ashlars are dressed. This would, however, mean that the wall had a significant support wall – the base of the wall was never reached, as it became too challenging to work in the sondage. Clearly part of Locus 25, this locus is assigned to Stage 2, the construction of that wall.
0.21 m north south -by- 2.79 m east west.
